data.prayer: Father, please remove the barriers that keep the 503,187 who are far from you in Agadez, Niger from having access to a Bible.
data.verse: And this gospel of the kingdom will be preached in the whole world as a testimony to all nations, and then the end will come.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Agadez, Niger
data.section_summary: What people or activities could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: Spirit, disrupt complacency in the 4,949 believers living in the state of Agadez. Remind them you are coming soon.
data.verse: Therefore, stay awake, for you do not know on what day your Lord is coming.

data.prayer: Jesus, you taught Paul to train Timothy to train faithful men who would train others. Please, teach the church of Agadez, Niger to do the same.
data.verse: And the things you have heard me say in the presence of many witnesses entrust to reliable people who will also be qualified to teach others.

data.prayer: Lord, teach the young people in the state of Agadez to trust your Word and find the path of purity.
data.verse: How can a young person stay on the path of purity? By living according to your word.

data.prayer: Lord we ask you on behalf of the Tuareg, Asben people. 0.8% are known to be believers. Oh God, please share with them the great gift of your son Jesus and your kingdom.
Father, like with the Ethiopian Eunuch, set up a meeting today between a faithful believer in Agadez, Niger and a person seeking to understand the truth.
data.verse: The eunuch asked Philip, “Tell me, please, who is the prophet talking about, himself or someone else?” Then Philip began with that very passage of Scripture and told him the good news about Jesus.

data.prayer: Lord, we pray for the believers in Agadez, Niger to be more like Jesus in their love for friends and enemies.
data.verse: But I tell you, love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you.

data.prayer: Spirit, cause the 4,949 believers in Agadez to obey with immediate, radical, costly obedience, like Abraham.
data.verse: Then God said, “Take your son, your only son, whom you love — Isaac — and go to the region of Moriah. Sacrifice him there as a burnt offering on a mountain I will show you.” Early the next morning Abraham got up and loaded his donkey. He took with him two of his servants and his son Isaac. When he had cut enough wood for the burnt offering, he set out for the place God had told him about.

location.name: Agadez
location.people_groups_list: Tuareg, Air, Daza, Tasawaq, Tetserret, Tuareg, Tahaggart
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Tuareg, Air (449,000), Daza (89,000), Tasawaq (20,000), Tetserret (2,200), Tuareg, Tahaggart (48,000)
